description.narrative: Output 7.1: Strengthened data generation and analyses, and evidence-based legislation and policies that promote social inclusion., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Environmental Sustainability, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 7: Improved policy environment and equitable systems for disadvantaged and excluded children, guided by evidence and meaningful participation of children at national and decentralized levels

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty public advocacy (media and social media, campaigns)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework
UNICEF Zimbabwe Humanitarian Action for Children Appeal (HAC)
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Zimbabwe 2021 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 7.1: Strengthened data generation and analyses, and evidence-based legislation and policies that promote social inclusion.
MDG and ZIM ASSET Progress Report timely produced and disseminated

target.value: 2015:2014/5 MDG report, ZIM ASSET progress report

actual.value: 2015:UNICEF contributed to the review of the last MDG report and actively participated in the national process to develop a Zimbabwe Common Position for the SDGs.

title.narrative: Number of equity focused secondary data analyses completed

target.value: 2015:Census, PICES, Disability Survey secondary data analyses and SitAn completed

actual.value: 2015:Secondary analysis of the PICES and Census was used to produce the Poverty Atlas. Census data was used to produce the Child and Youth Equity Atlas. Secondary analysis of the MICS data was done on 5 broad themes: (i) Education, (ii) Religion, (iii) Health, Nutrition and WASH, (iv) Early Marriage, Att

title.narrative: Number of national household surveys completed to measure equity focused outcome and impact (L4 monitoring) indicators.

target.value: 2015:4 (MICS 2014, DHS 2016, Child Labour Survey 2014, Disability Survey).

actual.value: 2015:The MICS, Child Labour survey and National Disability survey were all completed and reports are available. Preparatory work ahs started for the DHS 2016.
